issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
There are several javadoc issues:

* Class JavaDoc is missing.
* {{getInstance()}} is missing {{@return}} and {{@param}} tags.
* {{parse()}} is missing {{@return}} tag and description for {{@throws}} tag.
* {{checkIfUsageOverFairShare()}} is missing a period at the end of the first sentence.
* {{getHeadroom()}} should use {code}{@code}{code} instead of {{<code>}} tags.

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for the update, [~cheersyang].  It occurred to me after I posted my comments that adding the class docs requires a bit more understanding of the inner working of YARN than is fair for a newbie JIRA.  Let's do this.  I'll commit your first patch and then file a new JIRA to add the class javadoc.  With that in mind, +1 to patch 1.

Hi [~templedf]

I appreciate that, but I am not new to Yarn, do you think the doc I added for this class is not appropriate? I can do a better job than that if you let me know why? Thank you.

Alrighty then! Let's work on the text.  The {{SchedulingPolicy}} is used by the fair scheduler mainly to determine what a queue's fair share and steady fair share should be as well as calculating available headroom.  Every queue has one, including parents and children.  The policy for a child queue must be compatible with the policy of the parent queue; there are some combinations that aren't allowed.  See {{isChildPolicyAllowed()}}.  The policy for a queue is specified by setting <whatever the property is> in the fair scheduler configuration file.  If a child queue doesn't specify a policy, it inherits the parent's policy.  The default policy is {{FairSharePolicy}}.

Hi [~templedf]

Thank you so much for the detail note, this is good. I used to use a simple sentence or two for class doc but it is really helpful like this one, I only modified a bit (mostly format) and uploaded this in v3 patch. Again, thank you for providing your ideas and thoughtful explanation. I appreciate that.
LGTM.  +1 on the latest patch, pending a clean bill of health from Jenkins.
